Synopsis:
Year 1987 in Baghdad when the Iraqi army lieutenant Latif Yahia (Dominic Cooper), is summoned from the frontline to Saddam Hussein's palace and is thrust into the highest echelons of the royal family to have to become, thanks to his physical resemblance, at twice the son of Saddam, the famous prince Uday Hussein (Dominic Cooper), a reckless young man with a ferocious hunger for sex and brutality. With his life and his family at stake, Latif decides to give up his former self forever as he learns to walk, talk and act like Uday. With one wrong move could cost him his life, Latif forges an intimate bond with Sarrab (Ludivine Sagnier), Uday's seductive mistress who's haunted by his own secret agents. But as she weaves a war with Kuwait and Uday hangs with a gangster regime threatens to destroy them all, Latif realizes that escape from the devil's den will have a high price.

Production notes:
- Based on a true memories collected am Latif Yahia
